definition: to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)

sentences.english: Slaughter, hair removal, dig out the visceral.
If you let your dog dig up my flower bed again, I'll have the law on you.
sentences.chinese: 如果你再让你的狗挖掉我的花坛，我将去请警察了。

sentences.english: Click here to start a sequence of exercises where the percentage is omitted .
sentences.chinese: 单击此处开始一系列挖掉百分比值的考试。

sentences.english: It is impossible for you so few people to dig out such high mountains.
sentences.chinese: 你们父子数人要挖掉这样两座大山是不可能的。

sentences.english: The masses of serfs and slaves had no right to receive education.
sentences.chinese: 残忍的农奴主挖掉了农奴的眼睛。

sentences.english: The old apple tree must be grubbed up and young one planted.
sentences.chinese: 老苹果树必须挖掉，种上幼树。

sentences.english: A angered by asleep, and at night the stepmother eyes.
sentences.chinese: 一次惹怒了后娘，夜里熟睡之际被后娘挖掉了眼睛。

sentences.english: The first step is to remove all of the old filling.
sentences.chinese: 第一步先把所有的填补物都挖掉。

sentences.english: We should dig out weeds before sowing seeds.
sentences.chinese: 在播种前我们得先将杂草挖掉。

sentences.english: There is a hole in the apple, cut it out before you eat it.
sentences.chinese: 苹果上有一个虫眼，要把它挖掉再吃。

sentences.english: One body had its heart ripped out.
sentences.chinese: 有一张照片上显示一个被挖掉心脏的身体。

sentences.english: The cruel serf-owner put out the serf's eyes.
sentences.chinese: 残忍的农奴主挖掉了农奴的眼睛。

definition: to dig into/to cut a mine into
to flatten/to level/to raze to the ground
to pry open or apart/to spread (sth) open with both hands
to skin/to flay/to excoriate/to peel/to bark at sb/to physically punish sb
same as 剝皮|剥皮[bao1 pi2]
to scrape off/to shave off (whiskers etc)/(of the wind) to blow sth away
